description: A CIViC Gene Summary is created to provide a high-level overview of clinical relevance of cancer variants for the gene. Gene Summaries in CIViC focus on emphasizing the clinical relevance from a molecular perspective rather than describing the biological function of the gene unless necessary to contextualize its clinical relevance in cancer. Gene Summaries include relevant cancer subtypes, specific treatments for the geneâ€™s associated variants, pathway interactions, functional alterations caused by the variants in the gene, and normal/abnormal functions of the gene with associated roles in oncogenesis
name: CIViC Gene

resources.description: CIViC is an open access, open source, community-driven web resource for Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer.

institution.description: Washington University in St. Louis is a place where people matter and serious work is done. Our mission is to discover and disseminate knowledge, and to protect the freedom of inquiry through research, teaching and learning.
institution.name: Washington University in St. Louis

resources.name: Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer (CIViC)
